means: [男子名] 朱尼尔来源于拉丁语，含义是“较年幼的”(the younger)

sentence.Network_en: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
sentence.Network_cn: 她现在与比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

sentence.Network_en: The vacant W.B.C. junior-lightweight title has been called off.
sentence.Network_cn: 空缺的世界拳击理事会次轻量级头衔被取消了。

sentence.Network_en: Our doctor diagnosed a throat infection and prescribed antibiotic and junior aspirin.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们的医生诊断是喉部感染，并且开了一些抗生素和小剂量阿司匹林。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as an adjective following a family name): from Latin, comparative of juvenis 'young'

encyclopedia.content: 韩宜邦，1981年2月25日出生，台湾演员、主持人、歌手，毕业于中华大学营建工程学系。曾组成歌唱组合丸子（另两位团员为小鬼及绿茶），但只发行了一张专辑《关东煮》便告解散。

entry.tran: 职位（或地位）较低的；年资较浅的
entry.def: A junior official or employee holds a low-ranking position in an organization or profession.

example.ex: Junior and middle-ranking civil servants have pledged to join the indefinite strike.
example.tran: 基层和中层公务员已承诺要加入到无限期罢工中来。

example.ex: ...a junior minister attached to the prime minister's office.
example.tran: 在总理公署任职的助理部长

entry.def: If you are someone's junior, you are younger than they are.

example.ex: She now lives with actor Denis Lawson, 10 years her junior.
example.tran: 她现在与比她小10岁的演员丹尼斯·劳森同居。

entry.tran: 小（用于男子名后以区别于家族中同名的长辈，缩略形式为Jr）
entry.def: Junior is sometimes used after the name of the younger of two men in a family who have the same name, sometimes in order to prevent confusion. The abbreviation Jr is also used.

example.ex: His son, Arthur Ochs Junior, is expected to succeed him as publisher.
example.tran: 他的儿子，小阿瑟·奥克斯，有望子承父业继续从事出版。

entry.tran: （美国高中或大学的）三年级学生
entry.def: In the United States, a student in the third year of a high school or university course is called a junior.

example.ex: Their youngest daughter Amy's a junior at the University of Evansville in Indiana...
example.tran: 他们的小女儿埃米是印第安纳州埃文斯维尔大学三年级的学生。

example.ex: It was the summer before his junior year in high school.
example.tran: 那是他升入高三前的那个夏天。

means.word_mean: 1. term of address for a disrespectful and annoying male;

sentences.sentence: "look here, junior, it's none of your business"

means.word_mean: 1. younger; lower in rank; shorter in length of tenure or service
2. used of the third or next to final year in United States high school or college;
3. including or intended for youthful persons;

auth_sentence.content: She is already the junior world time trial champion.
auth_sentence.res_content: She is already the junior world time trial champion.

auth_sentence.content: That is a junior record that still stands today.
auth_sentence.res_content: That is a junior record that still stands today.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That is a junior record that still stands today.

auth_sentence.content: I had that in my junior year in college.
auth_sentence.res_content: I had that in my junior year in college.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表形容词或表名词,"较……的;较……"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的
stems_affixes.word_buile: infer下面+ior较……的;较……→adj.下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的 n.下级,晚辈
inter在……内+ior较……的;较……→adj.内部的,里面的 n.内部,内地
sen老+ior较……的;较……→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
super在……上面+ior较……的;较……→adj.优良的,卓越的;上级的 n.上级;长者;高手

stems_affixes.value_cn: 较晚的,较远的,不可告人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ulter远+ior较……的;较……→adj.较晚的,较远的,不可告人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 年少的/者,三年级的/学生,下级[的]
stems_affixes.word_buile: jun年轻+ior较……的;较……→adj.&n.年少的/者,三年级的/学生,下级[的]
infer下面+ior较……的;较……→adj.下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的 n.下级,晚辈
inter在……内+ior较……的;较……→adj.内部的,里面的 n.内部,内地
sen老+ior较……的;较……→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
super在……上面+ior较……的;较……→adj.优良的,卓越的;上级的 n.上级;长者;高手

stems_affixes.value_cn: 年少的,资历较浅的,等级较低的
stems_affixes.word_buile: jun年轻+ior较……[的]→adj.年少的,资历较浅的,等级较低的 n.年少者;晚辈;三年级生
jun年轻+ior较……[的]→adj.年少的,资历较浅的,等级较低的 n.年少者;晚辈;三年级生

Sentence.sentence: Junior employees being made to work overtime.
Researchers in one study in Tokyo found that more than half of junior high school students used their phones to exchange e-mails with schoolmates more than 10 times a day.
Juan Louis, a junior geology major, decided to give an informative speech about how earthquakes occur.

means.word_mean: 资历较浅的, 地位较低的

sentences.en: We could give the job to somebody junior.
sentences.cn: 我们可以把这份工作交给职位较低的人。

sentences.en: She is my junior by three years.

means.word_mean: 职位较低者；低层次工作人员
(美国中学或大学的)三年级学生

sentences.en: Mary, a junior, will graduate next year.
sentences.cn: 玛丽, 一名三年级的中学生, 明年将毕业。

jushi.english: He was a junior officer of the troop.
jushi.chinese: 他在这个部队里是个下级军官。

jushi.english: I am only a junior person.
jushi.chinese: 我只不过是个无名小卒罢了。
